Menus Bar sample menu Opening hours Sunday – Thursday 3 – 11pm Friday and Saturday 3pm – 1am General information Dress code Smart casual Guests Adults only Vibe Stylish setting Entertainment Art Cuisine Drinks Nightly music Live entertainment The Bar & Lounge invites you to linger over a delicious cocktail while you enjoy our live music sessions every evening. ART Lining the walls Norman Seeff’s iconic photographs line the walls of the Bar & Lounge, capturing artists and innovators such Cher, Tina Turner and Steve Jobs in unique and unguarded moments. CUISINE To complement a cocktail or two The Bar & Lounge's afternoon and evening menu offers casual late-day and dinner fare, including a Mediterranean mezze platter or artisanal cheeses to share, as well as a selection of entrées. Drinks The finest tastes An inventive cocktail menu, utilising the freshest ingredients of the season paired with high-end spirits. 01 10 Restaurants and bars at Hotel Bel-Air explore all restaurants and bars For every occasion and every mood, Hotel Bel-Air has the restaurant for you. The place to be The Restaurant at Hotel Bel-Air The finest, locally-sourced ingredients crafted into a creative menu. Delivering modern Californian cuisine with a Mediterranean influence in a relaxed, yet elegant setting. This is LA dining at its stylish best. Book your table Explore Casual The Pâtisserie at Hotel Bel-Air Designed to evoke the nostalgia of a classic French boulangerie, yet carefully tailored to the relaxed California vibe that is Hotel Bel-Air. Order online Explore Cosy and intimate The Living Room Acting as a wonderful introduction to our legendary low-key glamour, this is an airy space of not only great beauty but somewhere to gather, meet with friends, and celebrate good times. Feel at home from the moment you arrive. Explore GIFTS & EXPERIENCES Worthy of any wishlist Share the Hollywood moment with our curated selection of gifts and experiences, inspired by Hotel Bel-Air. Explore Gifts & Experiences Get in touch with us Please get in touch if you have any questions about our hotels, a hotel reservation or a booking at one of our restaurants, bars or spas. Ybor City, Tampa | Columbia Restaurant top of page Columbia Restaurant Since 1905 – Florida's Oldest Restaurant℠ Gift Cards Home Reservations Lunch & Dinner Reservations Group Dining & Catering Curbside Pickup Flamenco Show - Ybor City Locations View All Locations Ybor City, Tampa St. Armands Circle, Sarasota Historic District, St. Augustine Sand Key, Clearwater Celebration, Near Orlando Columbia Cafe at the TBHC Columbia Cafe at Tampa Airport Food & Drink Menus Recipes Curbside Pickup Group Dining & Catering Wine – Columbia Vino Club Our Story About Us In The News Media Kit Sponsorship & Donations FAQ Join Our Team Shop Gift Cards Gift Shop Ybor City, Tampa Live music, gourmet food and more than 120 years of history. Visit The Original Columbia Restaurant in Ybor City, Tampa. RESERVATIONS Hours Of Operation: 11 a.m. - 9 p.m. Sunday through Thursday 11 a.m. -  10 p.m. Friday & Saturday To Order Convenient Curbside Pickup: CALL NOW For Events, Banquets And Catering: Contact us 2117 E. 7th Ave., Tampa, FL 33605 Donation & Sponsorship Requests Lunch Menu dinner Menu Flamenco Show Named "One of Florida's Top Restaurants" since 1967. Located at 2117 E. 7th Ave., the Columbia Restaurant has a total of 52,000 square feet with seating for up to 1,700 customers and encompasses an entire city block. It earned the "Distinguished Restaurants of North America Award of Excellence" 2005 - 2008, one of the most prestigious awards in the fine dining industry. 1903 Cafe Dining Room The 1903 corner saloon transformed into the Columbia Restaurant in 1905, using the same iconic bar. Today, the Cafe Dining room is one of 15 dining rooms in the restaurant. Read More 1935 The Red Room Opened in 1935 with the Don Quixote dining room, then known as the Red Lounge bar in the 1960s and '70s, this dining room once featured entrances to the restaurant's secret speakeasy. Read More 1937 El Patio Balcony The balcony above the Patio Dining Room features exquisite hand-painted tiles and expansive access to natural light. Read More 2001 La Familia Dining Room The Familia de Casimiro was named in honor of the founder of the restaurant, Casimiro Hernandez Sr., and is designed to resemble a Spanish wine cellar, with space for private meetings. Read More 1920 La Fonda Dining Room Once its own restaurant neighboring the Saloon Columbia, La Fonda became a Columbia Restaurant dining room at the start of Prohibition. Read More 1937 Kings Room The Kings Dining room offers private dining and a dance floor for special events such as banquets and ceremonies.  Portraits of past and present Kings & Queens of the Krewe of the Knights of Sant' Yago of Gasparilla hang on the walls. Read More 1937 Sancho Panza Dining Room This dining room, named for Don Quixote's faithful companion, opened the same year as El Patio because of the success of the Don Quoxite Dining Room. Read More 2001 Andalucia Dining Room This is one of two new dining rooms built in the restaurant since the 1950s. The Andalucia dining room seats up to 80 people. Read More 1935 Don Quixote Dining Room When the Don Quixote Room opened in 1935 it became not only Tampa’s first air-conditioned dining room, but also featured colorful tiles depicting the windmill-tilting character of Cervantes’ classic novel. Read More 1937 El Patio Dining Room The colorful mosaic-tiled fountain in the Patio Dining Room has a statue in the middle called "Arion and the Dolphin.” The statue is a replica of a sculpture found in the ruins of Pompeii. Read More 1955 El Siboney Dining Room Opening on New Year’s Eve 1955, the Siboney Room once featured two fountains, sculptures, paintings, tapestries and antiques. Today, this ballroom hosts flamenco performances and large banquets. Read More 2002 Don Quixote Mezzanine In 2001, 4th-generation caretaker Richard Gonzmart rebuilt the original Don Quixote Mezzanine from the room's opening in 1935. Read More Room By Room - Ybor Browse Gift Cards FAQ - Dress Code Feedback Hiring Restaurants By Location Accessibility Statement Donation Requests Follow Us Subscribe To Our Email Newsletter Email Subscribe © 2022 by Columbia Restaurant. Visit 1905Family.com To Learn About Our Sibling Restaurants. bottom of page

Cookie settings ACCEPT Manage consent Close Privacy Overview This website uses cookies to improve your experience while you navigate through the website. Out of these cookies, the cookies that are categorized as necessary are stored on your browser as they are essential for the working of basic functionalities of the website. We also use third-party cookies that help us analyze and understand how you use this website. These cookies will be stored in your browser only with your consent. You also have the option to opt-out of these cookies. But opting out of some of these cookies may have an effect on your browsing experience. Necessary Necessary Always Enabled Necessary cookies are absolutely essential for the website to function properly. This category only includes cookies that ensures basic functionalities and security features of the website. These cookies do not store any personal information. Non-necessary Non-necessary Any cookies that may not be particularly necessary for the website to function and is used specifically to collect user personal data via analytics, ads, other embedded contents are termed as non-necessary cookies. It is mandatory to procure user consent prior to running these cookies on your website. SAVE & ACCEPT

Staff & Board of Directors - Diamond Head Theatre Skip to content Box Office: (808) 733-0274 | Business Office: (808) 733-0277 Facebook Instagram YouTube LinkedIn Email Search for: Shows & Tickets Buy Tickets Season Subscriptions Seat Map Show Archive Subscriber Login Donate Annual Giving Capital Campaign Producer’s Club Sponsorship ‘Ilima Awards Auditions Show Auditions Shooting Stars Classes Year-Round Classes Summer Musical Theatre Experience Shooting Stars Instructors Scholarships About Staff & Board of Directors Instructors Volunteer Rentals News Show Archive Your New Theatre Theatrical Arts Building Make a Gift Sponsor a Seat Photos News Capital Campaign Donors Contact BUY TICKETS Staff & Board of Directors Jacque Vaughn 2025-07-23T06:29:51-10:00 STAFF & BOARD OF DIRECTORS We bring the magic of theatre to all Trevor Tamashiro, Executive Director Trevor joined Diamond Head Theatre as Executive Director in April 2023. Born and raised in Hawaii, and a graduate of Punahou School, he brings nearly 20 years of experience in nonprofit executive leadership. Trevor started his journey in New York City working for Broadway Dance Center. Other positions include: Chief Advancement Officer of The Diller-Quaile School of Music; Deputy Director of Saratoga International Theater Institute; and Deputy/Program Director for The Drama League of New York. Trevor is a member of the Association of Fundraising Professionals and is a Certified Fund Raising Executive (CFRE). He holds a degree in Theatre Arts from University of Miami, a Master of Business Administration degree from Pace University, and a Master of Science degree in Nonprofit Management from Columbia University. John Rampage, Artistic Director John Rampage is a performer, actor, choreographer, and director who has served as Diamond Head Theatre’s Artistic Director since 1995. He is the creative mastermind behind all of the theatre’s productions and programs, overseeing the curation of two or more shows each season and selects directors, musical directors, and set designers. His relationship with the theatre began in 1975 where he performed as Tommy Gilas in the 1975 production of Music Man. In the 1980s, Rampage danced and sang his way across the U.S. and Europe and returned in 1991 as choreographer of Evita. More than 120 productions have been shared with the community under his oversight. A 47-time Po‘okela Award winner for excellence in the theatre, John is also the recipient of the Hawaii State Theatre Council 2006 Pierre Bowman Award.
